Posts.Content: JJust got back from seeing my consultant, and my tumour has now shrunk from 8cm down to 1cm, I only have one more lot of chemo to do then its looking at surgery, I feel so relieved and am not feeling so scared now xx
Posts.Title: feeling hopeful

Posts.Content: All I was worried about was losing my long hair but now I don't care about that. Same as you I just want to get on with my life. I am not going to go for reconstruction either I just want rid of the cancer for good.
Posts.Title: last chemo,

Posts.Content: Unfortunately I will be on my own, that's probably why I am also feeling like this. I am waiting to go and have another mammogram and me I scan and to discuss surgery, I would rather have the breast removed. But family members disagree with me.
Posts.Title: last chemo,

Posts.Content: I am just so worried it will come back.
Posts.Title: last chemo,

Posts.Content: Had last chemo cancelled last week due to platelets being low, rescheduled for tomorrow, but I had the best news today I went to see my consultant and she couldn't find my tumour in my breast so went for a mammogram and it didn't show up there so its gone :) am due for surgery and of octber and then radiotherapy after. I am so pleased and happy I can't stop smiling and that's something I haven't done in a long time :) xx
Posts.Title: last chemo,

Posts.Content: Hi I am due to have my last chemo tomorrow, I am feeling anxious and relieved at the same time. I know I should be relieved but I am worried about the unknown all again, I have had 6 rounds of chemo, I should of been having 8 but agreed with my consultant to have justv1 more as my tumour has shrunk from 8 cm to 1 cm and I was finding it very hard to deal with I was on the verge of giving up all treatment until I saw my consultant, I am having mixed emotions this evening, has anybody else felt like this ?
Posts.Title: last chemo,
